item.title: Chapter One - Object Oriented Properties
item.description: Object-oriented programming is a programming paradigm, or classification, that organizes a group of data attributes with functions or methods into a unit, known as an object. Typically, OOP languages are class-based, meaning a class defines the data attributes and functions as a blueprint for creating objects, which are instances of the class. One class may represent multiple independent objects, which interact with each other in complex ways. First Chapter: Introduction to OOP Concepts: It is important to note that the title of this first chapter is “Introduction to Object-Oriented Concepts.
